sentences.en: A large, soft tomato , unerringly aimed , stuck the chairman in the face.
sentences.cn: 一只又大又烂的西红柿, 不偏不倚地正好打在董事长的脸上.
巴雷特担任副主席一职。

sentences.en: By 1971 he resigned as president and assumed the title of chairman.
sentences.cn: 到1971年,他辞去总裁职务,出任董事长.

sentences.en: deputy/vice chairman Barrett serves as vice chairman.
sentences.cn: 巴雷特担任副主席一职。

sentences.en: I had done business with the company's chairman.
sentences.cn: 我和那家公司的总裁有过生意往来。

sentences.en: In his first years as chairman he was instrumental in raising the company's wider profile.
sentences.cn: 他任董事长的最初几年为提升公司的知名度起到了积极的推动作用。

sentences.en: No longer trammel by his responsibility as chairman, he can say what he wish.
sentences.cn: 他不当董事长就不受职务约束了, 想说什么就说什么.

sentences.en: The chairman decided to change the factory over to bicycle production.
sentences.cn: 董事长决定把这个工厂改为生产自行车.

sentences.en: The chairman decided to switch the factory over to bicycle production.
sentences.cn: 董事长决定使该厂改产自行车.

sentences.en: The chairman expatiated for two hours on his plans for the company.
sentences.cn: 董事长用两小时阐述了公司的规划.

sentences.en: The chairman of the bench adjourned the case until October 27.
sentences.cn: 主审法官将案件延期到10月27日审理。

sentences.en: The chairman of the company claims to have worked his way up from delivery boy.
sentences.cn: 公司董事长声称他是从一名送货童逐步提上去的.

sentences.en: The job of chairman can no longer be regarded as a convenient soft option.
sentences.cn: 别再以为董事长这份工作是那么容易做的。

sentences.en: The Vice - Chairmen and the Secretary - General assist the Chairman in his work.
sentences.cn: 副委员长、 秘书长 协助委员长工作.

sentences.en: This gave Bill an opportunity to hobnob with the company'spresident, board chairman, and leading executives.
sentences.cn: 这使得比尔有机会和公司的总裁、董事长以及那些主要行政主管们厮混在一起。

sentences.en: When the chairman of Campbell's retired, McGovern was named as his successor.
sentences.cn: 坎贝尔公司的总裁退休后，麦戈文被选定为继任者。

sentences.en: With the whole meeting in uproar, the chairman abandoned the attempt to take a vote.
sentences.cn: 因为整个会议一片喧嚣, 主持会议的人放弃了投票表决的尝试.

phrases.tran_cn: n. 董事长；董事局主席

trans.tran_en: someone, especially a man, who is in charge of a meeting or directs the work of a committee or an organization
